name: Prophet Musa (as)
translation: And (further) their Prophet said to them: "A Sign of his authority is that there shall come to you the Ark of the covenant, with (an assurance) therein of security from your Lord, and the relics left by the family of Moses and the family of Aaron, carried by angels. In this is a symbol for you if ye indeed have faith."

name: Prophet Isaac (as)
translation: We have sent thee inspiration, as We sent it to Noah and the Messengers after him: we sent inspiration to Abraham, Isma'il, Isaac, Jacob and the Tribes, to Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and solomon, and to David We gave the Psalms.

name: Prophet Isaac (as)
translation: We gave him Isaac and Jacob: all (three) guided: and before him, We guided Noah, and among his progeny, David, Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses, and Aaron: thus do We reward those who do good:

name: Prophet Musa (as)
translation: The Lord of Moses and Aaron.

name: Prophet Musa (as)
translation: We appointed for Moses thirty nights, and completed (the period) with ten (more): thus was completed the term (of communion) with his Lord, forty nights. And Moses had charged his brother Aaron (before he went up): "Act for me amongst my people: Do right, and follow not the way of those who do mischief."

name: Prophet Musa (as)
translation: When Moses came back to his people, angry and grieved, he said: "Evil it is that ye have done in my place in my absence: did ye make haste to bring on the judgment of your Lord?" He put down the tablets, seized his brother by (the hair of) his head, and dragged him to him. Aaron said: "Son of my mother! the people did indeed reckon me as naught, and went near to slaying me! Make not the enemies rejoice over my misfortune, nor count thou me amongst the people of sin."

name: Forgiveness
subtopic2: Best of those who show mercy
Most Merciful of those who show mercy
translation: Moses prayed: "O my Lord! forgive me and my brother! admit us to Thy mercy! for Thou art the Most Merciful of those who show mercy!"

name: Prophet Musa (as)
translation: Then after them sent We Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his chiefs with Our Signs. But they were arrogant: they were a people in sin.

name: Prophet Musa (as)
translation: We inspired Moses and his brother with this Message: "Provide dwellings for your people in Egypt, make your dwellings into places of worship, and establish regular prayers: and give glad tidings to those who believe!"
Allah said: "Accepted is your prayer (O Moses and Aaron)! So stand ye straight, and follow not the path of those who know not."

name: Prophet Harun (as)
translation: O sister of Aaron! Thy father was not a man of evil, nor thy mother a woman unchaste!

name: Prophet Harun (as)
translation: And, out of Our Mercy, We gave him his brother Aaron, (also) a prophet.

name: Prophet Harun (as)
translation: Aaron, my brother;
Add to my strength through him,
And make him share my task:
That we may celebrate Thy praise without stint,
And remember Thee without stint:
For Thou art He that (ever) regardeth us.

name: Remembrance of Allah (swt)
translation: Go, thou and thy brother, with My Signs, and slacken not, either of you, in keeping Me in remembrance.

name: Prophet Musa (as)
translation: So the magicians were thrown down to prostration: they said, "We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses".

name: Prophet Harun (as)
translation: (Moses) said: "O Aaron! what kept thee back, when thou sawest them going wrong,

name: Disobedience
translation: From following me? Didst thou then disobey my order?

name: Swearing
translation: (Aaron) replied: "O son of my mother! Seize (me) not by my beard nor by (the hair of) my head! Truly I feared lest thou shouldst say, 'Thou has caused a division among the children of Israel, and thou didst not respect my word!'"

name: Taqwa
translation: In the past We granted to Moses and Aaron the criterion (for judgment), and a Light and a Message for those who would do right,-

name: Prophet Musa (as)
translation: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron, with Our Signs and authority manifest,

name: About Arrogance
translation: To Pharaoh and his Chiefs: But these behaved insolently: they were an arrogant people.
They said: "Shall we believe in two men like ourselves? And their people are subject to us!"
So they accused them of falsehood, and they became of those who were destroyed.

name: Prophet Musa (as)
translation: (Before this,) We sent Moses The Book, and appointed his brother Aaron with him as minister;
And We command: "Go ye both, to the people who have rejected our Signs:" And those (people) We destroyed with utter destruction.

name: Prophet Harun (as)
translation: My breast will be straitened. And my speech may not go (smoothly): so send unto Aaron.

name: Prophet Musa (as)
translation: The Lord of Moses and Aaron.

name: Truth and Honesty
translation: And my brother Aaron - He is more eloquent in speech than I: so send him with me as a helper, to confirm (and strengthen) me: for I fear that they may accuse me of falsehood.

He said: "We will certainly strengthen thy arm through thy brother, and invest you both with authority, so they shall not be able to touch you: with Our Sign shall ye triumph,- you two as well as those who follow you."

name: Prophet Musa (as)
translation: Again (of old) We bestowed Our favour on Moses and Aaron,
And We delivered them and their people from (their) Great Calamity;
And We helped them, so they overcame (their troubles);
And We gave them the Book which helps to make things clear;
And We guided them to the Straight Way.
And We left (this blessing) for them among generations (to come) in later times:

name: Prophet Musa (as)
translation: Peace and salutation to Moses and Aaron!
Thus indeed do We reward those who do right.
For they were two of our believing Servants.

name: Forgiveness
translation: O ye who believe! Approach not prayers with a mind befogged, until ye can understand all that ye say,- nor in a state of ceremonial impurity (Except when travelling on the road), until after washing your whole body. If ye are ill, or on a journey, or one of you cometh from offices of nature, or ye have been in contact with women, and ye find no water, then take for yourselves clean sand or earth, and rub therewith your faces and hands. For Allah doth blot out sins and forgive again and again.

name: On Women
mainTopic1: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation: O ye who believe! when ye prepare for prayer, wash your faces, and your hands (and arms) to the elbows; Rub your heads (with water); and (wash) your feet to the ankles. If ye are in a state of ceremonial impurity, bathe your whole body. But if ye are ill, or on a journey, or one of you cometh from offices of nature, or ye have been in contact with women, and ye find no water, then take for yourselves clean sand or earth, and rub therewith your faces and hands, Allah doth not wish to place you in a difficulty, but to make you clean, and to complete his favour to you, that ye may be grateful.

name: Prophet Isaac (as)
translation: Were ye witnesses when death appeared before Jacob? Behold, he said to his sons: "What will ye worship after me?" They said: "We shall worship Thy god and the god of thy fathers, of Abraham, Isma'il and Isaac,- the one (True) Allah: To Him we bow (in Islam)."

name: Prophet Isaac (as)
translation: Say ye: "We believe in Allah, and the revelation given to us, and to Abraham, Isma'il, Isaac, Jacob, and the Tribes, and that given to Moses and Jesus, and that given to (all) prophets from their Lord: We make no difference between one and another of them: And we bow to Allah (in Islam)."

name: Prophet Isaac (as)
subtopic2: is not unmindful of what you do
translation: Or do ye say that Abraham, Isma'il Isaac, Jacob and the Tribes were Jews or Christians? Say: Do ye know better than Allah? Ah! who is more unjust than those who conceal the testimony they have from Allah? but Allah is not unmindful of what ye do!

name: Prophet Isaac (as)
translation: When Abraham said: "Show me, Lord, how You will raise the dead, " He replied: "Have you no faith?" He said "Yes, but just to reassure my heart." Allah said, "Take four birds, draw them to you, and cut their bodies to pieces. Scatter them over the mountain-tops, then call them back. They will come swiftly to you. Know that Allah is Mighty, Wise."

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: Allah did choose Adam and Noah, the family of Abraham, and the family of 'Imran above all people,-

name: Prophet Isaac (as)
translation: Say: "We believe in Allah, and in what has been revealed to us and what was revealed to Abraham, Isma'il, Isaac, Jacob, and the Tribes, and in (the Books) given to Moses, Jesus, and the prophets, from their Lord: We make no distinction between one and another among them, and to Allah do we bow our will (in Islam)."

name: On Wisdom
translation: Or do they envy mankind for what Allah hath given them of his bounty? but We had already given the people of Abraham the Book and Wisdom, and conferred upon them a great kingdom.

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: Lo! Abraham said to his father Azar: "Takest thou idols for gods? For I see thee and thy people in manifest error."

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: So also did We show Abraham the power and the laws of the heavens and the earth, that he might (with understanding) have certitude.

name: Qur'an on Love
translation: When the night covered him over, He saw a star: He said: "This is my Lord." But when it set, He said: "I love not those that set."
When he saw the moon rising in splendour, he said: "This is my Lord." But when the moon set, He said: "unless my Lord guide me, I shall surely be among those who go astray."

When he saw the sun rising in splendour, he said: "This is my Lord; this is the greatest (of all)." But when the sun set, he said: "O my people! I am indeed free from your (guilt) of giving partners to Allah.
For me, I have set my face, firmly and truly, towards Him Who created the heavens and the earth, and never shall I give partners to Allah.

name: On Knowledge
translation: His people disputed with him. He said: "(Come) ye to dispute with me, about Allah, when He (Himself) hath guided me? I fear not (the beings) ye associate with Allah: Unless my Lord willeth, (nothing can happen). My Lord comprehendeth in His knowledge all things. Will ye not (yourselves) be admonished?

main_Topic2: all beings in the heavens and earth declare His glory
translation: How should I fear (the beings) ye associate with Allah, when ye fear not to give partners to Allah without any warrant having been given to you? Which of (us) two parties hath more right to security? (tell me) if ye know.

name: Faith
translation: It is those who believe and confuse not their beliefs with wrong - that are (truly) in security, for they are on (right) guidance.

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: That was the reasoning about Us, which We gave to Abraham (to use) against his people: We raise whom We will, degree after degree: for thy Lord is full of wisdom and knowledge.

name: Prophet Isaac (as)
translation: Thus will thy Lord choose thee and teach thee the interpretation of stories (and events) and perfect His favour to thee and to the posterity of Jacob - even as He perfected it to thy fathers Abraham and Isaac aforetime! for Allah is full of knowledge and wisdom.

name: Prophet Isaac (as)
translation: And I follow the ways of my fathers,- Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; and never could we attribute any partners whatever to Allah: that (comes) of the grace of Allah to us and to mankind: yet most men are not grateful.

name: Truth and Honesty
translation: (Also mention in the Book (the story of) Abraham: He was a man of Truth, a prophet.

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: We bestowed aforetime on Abraham his rectitude of conduct, and well were We acquainted with him.

name: Prophet Isaac (as)
subtopic2: in the ranks of the Righteous
translation: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: And remember We took from the prophets their covenant: As (We did) from thee: from Noah, Abraham, Moses, and Jesus the son of Mary: We took from them a solemn covenant:

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: Verily among those who followed his Way was Abraham.

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: Abraham was indeed a model, devoutly obedient to Allah, (and) true in Faith, and he joined not gods with Allah:
He showed his gratitude for the favours of Allah, who chose him, and guided him to a Straight Way.

name: Dunya
subtopic2: in the ranks of the Righteous
translation: And We gave him Good in this world, and he will be, in the Hereafter, in the ranks of the Righteous.

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: So We have taught thee the inspired (Message), "Follow the ways of Abraham the True in Faith, and he joined not gods with Allah."
None of Our revelations do We abrogate or cause to be forgotten, but We substitute something better or similar: Knowest thou not that Allah Hath power over all things?

name: Tawakkul
subtopic2: His example in dealing with unbelievers
to Him is the final goal
translation: There is for you an excellent example (to follow) in Abraham and those with him, when they said to their people: "We are clear of you and of whatever ye worship besides Allah: we have rejected you, and there has arisen, between us and you, enmity and hatred for ever,- unless ye believe in Allah and Him alone": But not when Abraham said to his father: "I will pray for forgiveness for thee, though I have no power (to get) aught on thy behalf from Allah." (They prayed): "Our Lord! in Thee do we trust, and to Thee do we turn in repentance: to Thee is (our) Final Goal.

name: Trials of Life
subtopic2: His example in dealing with unbelievers
translation: Our Lord! Make us not a (test and) trial for the Unbelievers, but forgive us, our Lord! for Thou art the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

name: Hajar
subtopic2: His example in dealing with unbelievers
translation: There was indeed in them an excellent example for you to follow,- for those whose hope is in Allah and in the Last Day. But if any turn away, truly Allah is Free of all Wants, Worthy of all Praise.

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: Remember We made the House a place of assembly for men and a place of safety; and take ye the station of Abraham as a place of prayer; and We covenanted with Abraham and Isma'il, that they should sanctify My House for those who compass it round, or use it as a retreat, or bow, or prostrate themselves (therein in prayer).

name: Rizq
translation: And remember Abraham said: "My Lord, make this a City of Peace, and feed its people with fruits,-such of them as believe in Allah and the Last Day." He said: "(Yea), and such as reject Faith,-for a while will I grant them their pleasure, but will soon drive them to the torment of Fire,- an evil destination (indeed)!"

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: And remember Abraham and Isma'il raised the foundations of the House (With this prayer): "Our Lord! Accept (this service) from us: For Thou art the All-Hearing, the All-knowing.

name: Kaabah
mainTopic1: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation: The first House (of worship) appointed for men was that at Bakka: Full of blessing and of guidance for all kinds of beings:

name: Kaabah
subtopic2: duty to visit Mecca (Makkah) for the Hajj
translation: In it are Signs Manifest; (for example), the Station of Abraham; whoever enters it attains security; Pilgrimage thereto is a duty men owe to Allah,- those who can afford the journey; but if any deny faith, Allah stands not in need of any of His creatures.

name: Rizq
translation: O our Lord! I have made some of my offspring to dwell in a valley without cultivation, by Thy Sacred House; in order, O our Lord, that they may establish regular Prayer: so fill the hearts of some among men with love towards them, and feed them with fruits: so that they may give thanks.

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
mainTopic1: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation: Behold! We gave the site, to Abraham, of the (Sacred) House, (saying): "Associate not anything (in worship) with Me; and sanctify My House for those who compass it round, or stand up, or bow, or prostrate themselves (therein in prayer).

name: People of Thamud
subtopic2: angels visit him to announce son
translation: There came Our messengers to Abraham with glad tidings. They said, "Peace!" He answered, "Peace!" and hastened to entertain them with a roasted calf.

subtopic2: angels visit him to announce son
translation: But when he saw their hands went not towards the (meal), he felt some mistrust of them, and conceived a fear of them. They said: "Fear not: We have been sent against the people of Lut."

name: Prophet Isaac (as)
subtopic2: angels visit him to announce son
translation: And his wife was standing (there), and she laughed: But we gave her glad tidings of Isaac, and after him, of Jacob.

name: On Women
subtopic2: angels visit him to announce son
translation: She said: "Alas for me! shall I bear a child, seeing I am an old woman, and my husband here is an old man? That would indeed be a wonderful thing!"

name: Blessings
subtopic2: angels visit him to announce son
translation: They said: "Dost thou wonder at Allah's decree? The grace of Allah and His blessings on you, o ye people of the house! for He is indeed worthy of all praise, full of all glory!"

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: When fear had passed from (the mind of) Abraham and the glad tidings had reached him, he began to plead with us for Lut's people.

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: For Abraham was, without doubt, forbearing (of faults), compassionate, and given to look to Allah.

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: O Abraham! Seek not this. The decree of thy Lord hath gone forth: for them there cometh a penalty that cannot be turned back!

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
subtopic2: angels visit him to announce son
translation: Tell them about the guests of Abraham.

name: Peace
subtopic2: angels visit him to announce son
translation: When they entered his presence and said, "Peace!" He said, "We feel afraid of you!"

subtopic2: angels visit him to announce son
translation: They said: "Fear not! We give thee glad tidings of a son endowed with wisdom."

subtopic2: angels visit him to announce son
translation: He said: "Do ye give me glad tidings that old age has seized me? Of what, then, is your good news?"

subtopic2: angels visit him to announce son
translation: They said: "We give thee glad tidings in truth: be not then in despair!"

name: Allah's Mercy
subtopic2: angels visit him to announce son
translation: He said: "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord, but such as go astray?"

name: Business
translation: Abraham said: "What then is the business on which ye (have come), O ye messengers (of Allah)?"
They said: "We have been sent to a people (deep) in sin,
Excepting the adherents of Lut: them we are certainly (charged) to save (from harm),- All -

name: Wife
translation: Except his wife, who, We have ascertained, will be among those who will lag behind.

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: When Our Messengers came to Abraham with the good news, they said: "We are indeed going to destroy the people of this township: for truly they are (addicted to) crime."

name: Wife
translation: He said: "But there is Lut there." They said: "Well do we know who is there: we will certainly save him and his following,- except his wife: she is of those who lag behind!"

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
subtopic2: angels visit him to announce son
translation: Has the story reached thee, of the honoured guests of Abraham?

name: Good Character
subtopic2: angels visit him to announce son
translation: Behold, they entered his presence, and said: "Peace!" He said, "Peace!" (and thought, "These seem) unusual people."

subtopic2: angels visit him to announce son
translation: Then he turned quickly to his household, brought out a fatted calf,

subtopic2: angels visit him to announce son
translation: And placed it before them.. he said, "Will ye not eat?"

subtopic2: angels visit him to announce son
translation: (When they did not eat), He conceived a fear of them. They said, "Fear not," and they gave him glad tidings of a son endowed with knowledge.

name: On Women
subtopic2: angels visit him to announce son
translation: But his wife came forward (laughing) aloud: she smote her forehead and said: "A barren old woman!"

subtopic2: angels visit him to announce son
translation: They said, "Even so has thy Lord spoken: and He is full of Wisdom and Knowledge."
(Abraham) said: "And what, O ye Messengers, is your errand (now)?"
They said, "We have been sent to a people (deep) in sin;-

name: Hajar
translation: To bring on, on them, (a shower of) stones of clay (brimstone),
Marked as from thy Lord for those who trespass beyond bounds.

subtopic2: approached his Lord with a sound heart
argues with his people against idols
translation: Behold! he approached his Lord with a sound heart.

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: Hast thou not Turned thy vision to one who disputed with Abraham About his Lord, because Allah had granted him power? Abraham said: "My Lord is He Who Giveth life and death." He said: "I give life and death". Said Abraham: "But it is Allah that causeth the sun to rise from the east: Do thou then cause him to rise from the West." Thus was he confounded who (in arrogance) rejected faith. Nor doth Allah Give guidance to a people unjust.

name: Dunya
translation: Let those fight in the cause of Allah Who sell the life of this world for the hereafter. To him who fighteth in the cause of Allah,- whether he is slain or gets victory - Soon shall We give him a reward of great (value).

name: Obedience To Parents
translation: Behold, he said to his father: "O my father! why worship that which heareth not and seeth not, and can profit thee nothing?

name: Obedience To Parents
translation: O my father! to me hath come knowledge which hath not reached thee: so follow me: I will guide thee to a way that is even and straight.

name: Disobedience
subtopic2: do not follow or obey or worship
translation: O my father! serve not Satan: for Satan is a rebel against (Allah) Most Gracious.

name: Shaitan / Satan
subtopic2: do not follow or obey or worship
translation: O my father! I fear lest a Penalty afflict thee from (Allah) Most Gracious, so that thou become to Satan a friend.

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: (The father) replied: "Dost thou hate my gods, O Abraham? If thou forbear not, I will indeed stone thee: Now get away from me for a good long while!"

name: Forgiveness
main_Topic2: all beings in the heavens and earth declare His glory
translation: Abraham said: "Peace be on thee: I will pray to my Lord for thy forgiveness: for He is to me Most Gracious.
And I will turn away from you (all) and from those whom ye invoke besides Allah: I will call on my Lord: perhaps, by my prayer to my Lord, I shall be not unblest.

name: Prophet Isaac (as)
translation: When he had turned away from them and from those whom they worshipped besides Allah, We bestowed on him Isaac and Jacob, and each one of them We made a prophet.

name: Truth and Honesty
translation: And We bestowed of Our Mercy on them, and We granted them lofty honour on the tongue of truth.

name: Obedience To Parents
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: Behold! he said to his father and his people, "What are these images, to which ye are (so assiduously) devoted?"

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: They said, "We found our fathers worshipping them."

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: He said, "Indeed ye have been in manifest error - ye and your fathers."

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: They said, "Have you brought us the Truth, or are you one of those who jest?"

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
Lord of the heavens and earth [Rabb al SamduFat wa al Ar4]
translation: He said, "Nay, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, He Who created them (from nothing): and I am a witness to this (Truth).

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: And by Allah, I have a plan for your idols - after ye go away and turn your backs..

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: So he broke them to pieces, (all) but the biggest of them, that they might turn (and address themselves) to it.

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? He must indeed be some man of impiety!"

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: They said, "We heard a youth talk of them: He is called Abraham."

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may bear witness."

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: They said, "Art thou the one that did this with our gods, O Abraham?"

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: He said: "Nay, this was done by - this is their biggest one! ask them, if they can speak intelligently!"

name: Nafs
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: So they turned to themselves and said, "Surely ye are the ones in the wrong!"

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: Then were they confounded with shame: (they said), "Thou knowest full well that these (idols) do not speak!"

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: (Abraham) said, "Do ye then worship, besides Allah, things that can neither be of any good to you nor do you harm?

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: Fie upon you, and upon the things that ye worship besides Allah! Have ye no sense?..

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: They said, "Burn him and protect your gods, If ye do (anything at all)!"

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: We said, "O Fire! be thou cool, and (a means of) safety for Abraham!"

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: Then they sought a stratagem against him: but We made them the ones that lost most!

name: On The Universe
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: But We delivered him and (his nephew) Lut (and directed them) to the land which We have blessed for the nations.

name: Oneness of Allah (swt)
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: Behold, he said to his father and his people: "What worship ye?"

name: Oneness of Allah (swt)
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: They said: "We worship idols, and we remain constantly in attendance on them."

name: Oneness of Allah (swt)
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: He said: "Do they listen to you when ye call (on them)?"

name: Oneness of Allah (swt)
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: Or do you good or harm?

name: Oneness of Allah (swt)
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: They said: "Nay, but we found our fathers doing thus (what we do)."

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: He said: "Do ye then see whom ye have been worshipping,-

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: Ye and your fathers before you?-

name: On The Universe
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: For they are enemies to me; not so the Lord and Cherisher of the Worlds;

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: Who created me, and it is He Who guides me;

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: Who gives me food and drink,

name: Health
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: And when I am ill, it is He Who cures me;

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: Who will cause me to die, and then to life (again);

name: Forgiveness
main_Topic2: all beings in the heavens and earth declare His glory
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: And who, I hope, will forgive me my faults on the day of Judgment.

name: Taqwa
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: And (We also saved) Abraham: behold, he said to his people, "Serve Allah and fear Him: that will be best for you- If ye understand!

name: Rizq
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: For ye do worship idols besides Allah, and ye invent falsehood. The things that ye worship besides Allah have no power to give you sustenance: then seek ye sustenance from Allah, serve Him, and be grateful to Him: to Him will be your return.

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: And if ye reject (the Message), so did generations before you: and the duty of the messenger is only to preach publicly (and clearly).

name: Verses on Killing
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: So naught was the answer of (Abraham's) people except that they said: "Slay him or burn him." But Allah did save him from the Fire. Verily in this are Signs for people who believe.

name: Qiyamah
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: And he said: "For you, ye have taken (for worship) idols besides Allah, out of mutual love and regard between yourselves in this life; but on the Day of Judgment ye shall disown each other and curse each other: and your abode will be the Fire, and ye shall have none to help."

name: Obedience To Parents
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: Behold! he said to his father and to his people, "What is that which ye worship?

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: Is it a falsehood- gods other than Allah- that ye desire?

name: On The Universe
subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: Then what is your idea about the Lord of the worlds?

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: Then did he cast a glance at the Stars.

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: And he said, "I am indeed sick (at heart)!"

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: So they turned away from him, and departed.

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: Then did he turn to their gods and said, "will ye not eat (of the offerings before you)?...

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: What is the matter with you that ye speak not (intelligently)?

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: Then did he turn upon them, striking (them) with the right hand.

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: Then came (the worshippers) with hurried steps, and faced (him).

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: He said: "Worship ye that which ye have (yourselves) carved?

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: But Allah has created you and your handwork!

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: They said, "Build him a furnace, and throw him into the blazing fire!"

subtopic2: argues with his people against idols
translation: (This failing), they then sought a stratagem against him, but We made them the ones most humiliated!

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: And of Abraham who fulfilled his engagements?-

subtopic2: Allah does not burden a soul more than it can bear
no one can bear the burdens of another
translation: Namely, that no bearer of burdens can bear the burden of another;

name: About Difficulties
subtopic1: Justice – Equity – Fairness – Judge With Justice – Equitably
translation: That man can have nothing but what he strives for;
That (the fruit of) his striving will soon come in sight:
Then will he be rewarded with a reward complete;

name: About Difficulties
subtopic2: to Him is the final goal
translation: That to thy Lord is the final Goal;

name: Qur'an on Love
translation: That it is He Who granteth Laughter and Tears;
That it is He Who granteth Death and Life;

name: Homosexuality
translation: That He did create in pairs,- male and female,
From a seed when lodged (in its place);
That He hath promised a Second Creation (Raising of the Dead);

name: Contentment
translation: That it is He Who giveth wealth and satisfaction;
That He is the Lord of Sirius (the Mighty Star);
And that it is He Who destroyed the (powerful) ancient 'Ad (people),

name: People of Thamud
translation: And the Thamud nor gave them a lease of perpetual life.

name: Prophet Nuh (as)
translation: And before them, the people of Noah, for that they were (all) most unjust and most insolent transgressors,
And He destroyed the Overthrown Cities (of Sodom and Gomorrah).
So that (ruins unknown) have covered them up.
And this is in the Books of the earliest (Revelation),-

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: The Books of Abraham and Moses.

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
subtopic2: in the ranks of the Righteous
translation: And who turns away from the religion of Abraham but such as debase their souls with folly? Him We chose and rendered pure in this world: And he will be in the Hereafter in the ranks of the Righteous.

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: Those were some of the prophets on whom Allah did bestow His Grace,- of the posterity of Adam, and of those who We carried (in the Ark) with Noah, and of the posterity of Abraham and Israel of those whom We guided and chose. Whenever the Signs of (Allah) Most Gracious were rehearsed to them, they would fall down in prostrate adoration and in tears.

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: Who can be better in religion than one who submits his whole self to Allah, does good, and follows the way of Abraham the true in Faith? For Allah did take Abraham for a friend.

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: And remember that Abraham was tried by his Lord with certain commands, which he fulfilled: He said: "I will make thee an Imam to the Nations." He pleaded: "And also (Imams) from my offspring!" He answered: "But My Promise is not within the reach of evil-doers."

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: They say: "Become Jews or Christians if ye would be guided (To salvation)." Say thou: "Nay! (I would rather) the Religion of Abraham the True, and he joined not gods with Allah."

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: Abraham was not a Jew nor yet a Christian; but he was true in Faith, and bowed his will to Allah's (Which is Islam), and he joined not gods with Allah.

name: Truth and Honesty
main_Topic2: all beings in the heavens and earth declare His glory
translation: Say: "Allah speaketh the Truth: follow the religion of Abraham, the sane in faith; he was not of the Pagans."

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: Say: "Verily, my Lord hath guided me to a way that is straight,- a religion of right,- the path (trod) by Abraham the true in Faith, and he (certainly) joined not gods with Allah."

name: On Wisdom
mainTopic1: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
subtopic2: in the ranks of the Righteous
translation: O my Lord! bestow wisdom on me, and join me with the righteous;

subtopic2: of the company of the Elect and the Good
translation: They were, in Our sight, truly, of the company of the Elect and the Good.

name: People of Thamud
translation: Hath not the story reached them of those before them?- the People of Noah, and 'Ad, and Thamud; the People of Abraham, the men of Midian, and the cities overthrown. To them came their messengers with clear signs. It is not Allah Who wrongs them, but they wrong their own souls.

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: Those of Abraham and Lut;

name: Prophet Isaac (as)
translation: And commemorate Our Servants Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, possessors of Power and Vision.

name: Remembrance of Allah (swt)
translation: Verily We did choose them for a special (purpose)- proclaiming the Message of the Hereafter.

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: Our Lord! make of us Muslims, bowing to Thy (Will), and of our progeny a people Muslim, bowing to Thy (will); and show us our place for the celebration of (due) rites; and turn unto us (in Mercy); for Thou art the Oft-Returning, Most Merciful.

name: On Wisdom
translation: Our Lord! send amongst them a Messenger of their own, who shall rehearse Thy Signs to them and instruct them in scripture and wisdom, and sanctify them: For Thou art the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: Remember Abraham said: "O my Lord! make this city one of peace and security: and preserve me and my sons from worshipping idols.

name: Disobedience
translation: O my Lord! they have indeed led astray many among mankind; He then who follows my (ways) is of me, and he that disobeys me,- but Thou art indeed Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful.

subtopic2: knowledge of the heavens and the earth
knows all you reveal and conceal
translation: O our Lord! truly Thou dost know what we conceal and what we reveal: for nothing whatever is hidden from Allah, whether on earth or in heaven.

name: Prophet Isaac (as)
translation: Praise be to Allah, Who hath granted unto me in old age Isma'il and Isaac: for truly my Lord is He, the Hearer of Prayer!

name: On The Prayer
translation: O my Lord! make me one who establishes regular Prayer, and also (raise such) among my offspring O our Lord! and accept Thou my Prayer.

name: Forgiveness
subtopic2: all mankind will stand before the Lord of the Worlds
translation: O our Lord! cover (us) with Thy Forgiveness - me, my parents, and (all) Believers, on the Day that the Reckoning will be established!

name: Truth and Honesty
translation: Grant me honourable mention on the tongue of truth among the latest (generations);

name: Inheritance
subtopic2: Gardens of Bliss and Felicity ( and Delights Naim )
translation: Make me one of the inheritors of the Garden of Bliss;

name: Forgiveness
translation: Forgive my father, for that he is among those astray;
And let me not be in disgrace on the Day when (men) will be raised up;-
The Day whereon neither wealth nor sons will avail,
But only he (will prosper) that brings to Allah a sound heart;

name: Hajar
translation: O my Lord! Grant me a righteous (son)!

name: On Women
main_Topic2: Free will ( to train human will )
translation: And why should ye not fight in the cause of Allah and of those who, being weak, are ill-treated (and oppressed)?- Men, women, and children, whose cry is: "Our Lord! Rescue us from this town, whose people are oppressors; and raise for us from Thee one who will protect; and raise for us from Thee one who will help!"

name: Shaitan / Satan
translation: Those who believe fight in the cause of Allah, and those who reject Faith Fight in the cause of Evil: So fight ye against the friends of Satan: feeble indeed is the cunning of Satan.

name: Zakat
translation: Hast thou not turned Thy vision to those who were told to hold back their hands (from fight) but establish regular prayers and spend in regular charity? When (at length) the order for fighting was issued to them, behold! a section of them feared men as - or even more than - they should have feared Allah: They said: "Our Lord! Why hast Thou ordered us to fight? Wouldst Thou not Grant us respite to our (natural) term, near (enough)?" Say: "Short is the enjoyment of this world: the Hereafter is the best for those who do right: Never will ye be dealt with unjustly in the very least!

main_Topic2: Free will ( to train human will )
translation: Wherever ye are, death will find you out, even if ye are in towers built up strong and high! If some good befalls them, they say, "This is from Allah"; but if evil, they say, "This is from thee" (O Prophet). Say: "All things are from Allah." But what hath come to these people, that they fail to understand a single fact?

name: Taqwa
subtopic2: comes from ourselves but good from Allah
translation: Whatever good, (O man!) happens to thee, is from Allah; but whatever evil happens to thee, is from thy (own) soul. and We have sent thee as a messenger to (instruct) mankind. And enough is Allah for a witness.

name: On The Universe
translation: Behold! his Lord said to him: "Bow (thy will to Me):" He said: "I bow (my will) to the Lord and Cherisher of the Universe."

name: Prophet Yaqub (as)
translation: And this was the legacy that Abraham left to his sons, and so did Jacob; "Oh my sons! Allah hath chosen the Faith for you; then die not except in the Faith of Islam."

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: Ye People of the Book! Why dispute ye about Abraham, when the Law and the Gospel Were not revealed Till after him? Have ye no understanding?

name: On Knowledge
translation: Ah! Ye are those who fell to disputing (Even) in matters of which ye had some knowledge! but why dispute ye in matters of which ye have no knowledge? It is Allah Who knows, and ye who know not!

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: Without doubt, among men, the nearest of kin to Abraham, are those who follow him, as are also this Prophet and those who believe: And Allah is the Protector of those who have faith.

name: Zakat
translation: And strive in His cause as ye ought to strive, (with sincerity and under discipline). He has chosen you, and has imposed no difficulties on you in religion; it is the cult of your father Abraham. It is He Who has named you Muslims, both before and in this (Revelation); that the Messenger may be a witness for you, and ye be witnesses for mankind! So establish regular Prayer, give regular Charity, and hold fast to Allah! He is your Protector - the Best to protect and the Best to help!

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
subtopic2: guides to Himself those who turn to Him
same as it was for the ones before you
translation: The same religion has He established for you as that which He enjoined on Noah - the which We have sent by inspiration to thee - and that which We enjoined on Abraham, Moses, and Jesus: Namely, that ye should remain steadfast in religion, and make no divisions therein: to those who worship other things than Allah, hard is the (way) to which thou callest them. Allah chooses to Himself those whom He pleases, and guides to Himself those who turn (to Him).

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: And Abraham prayed for his father's forgiveness only because of a promise he had made to him. But when it became clear to him that he was an enemy to Allah, he dissociated himself from him: for Abraham was most tender-hearted, forbearing.

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: Behold! Abraham said to his father and his people: "I do indeed clear myself of what ye worship:
(I worship) only Him Who made me, and He will certainly guide me.
So We gave him the good news of a boy ready to suffer and forbear.

name: Patience
translation: Then, when (the son) reached (the age of) (serious) work with him, he said: "O my son! I see in vision that I offer thee in sacrifice: Now see what is thy view!" (The son) said: "O my father! Do as thou art commanded: thou will find me, if Allah so wills one practising Patience and Constancy!"
So when they had both submitted their wills (to Allah), and he had laid him prostrate on his forehead (for sacrifice),

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: We called out to him "O Abraham!

name: Truth and Honesty
translation: Thou hast already fulfilled the vision! - thus indeed do We reward those who do right.
For this was obviously a trial-
And We ransomed him with a momentous sacrifice:

name: Prophet Ibrahim (as)
translation: And We sent Noah and Abraham, and established in their line Prophethood and Revelation: and some of them were on right guidance. But many of them became rebellious transgressors.

name: Taqwa
translation: When We substitute one revelation for another,- and Allah knows best what He reveals (in stages),- they say, "Thou art but a forger": but most of them understand not.
Perish the hands of the Father of Flame! Perish he!
No profit to him from all his wealth, and all his gains!
Burnt soon will he be in a Fire of Blazing Flame!

name: Peace
translation: Only the saying, "Peace! Peace".

name: Taqwa
translation: To the 'Ad people, (We sent) Hud, one of their (own) brethren: He said: O my people! worship Allah! ye have no other god but Him will ye not fear (Allah)?"

name: Remembrance of Allah (swt)
subtopic2: all that is on it will perish
Remembrance of Allah`s favours and grace _ commanded
translation: And remember how He made you inheritors after the 'Ad people and gave you habitations in the land: ye build for yourselves palaces and castles in (open) plains, and carve out homes in the mountains; so bring to remembrance the benefits (ye have received) from Allah, and refrain from evil and mischief on the earth.

name: Prophet Hud (as)
translation: To the 'Ad People (We sent) Hud, one of their own brethren. He said: "O my people! worship Allah! ye have no other god but Him. (Your other gods) ye do nothing but invent!

subtopic2: did not ask rewards from people
translation: O my people! I ask of you no reward for this (Message). My reward is from none but Him who created me: Will ye not then understand?

name: Forgiveness
translation: And O my people! Ask forgiveness of your Lord, and turn to Him (in repentance): He will send you the skies pouring abundant rain, and add strength to your strength: so turn ye not back in sin!
They said: "O Hud! No Clear (Sign) that hast thou brought us, and we are not the ones to desert our gods on thy word! Nor shall we believe in thee!

name: On Deception
translation: We say nothing but that (perhaps) some of our gods may have seized thee with imbecility. He said: "I call Allah to witness, and do ye bear witness, that I am free from the sin of ascribing, to Him,
Other gods as partners! so scheme (your worst) against me, all of you, and give me no respite.

name: Tawakkul
subtopic2: has grasp of every creature`s forelock
translation: I put my trust in Allah, My Lord and your Lord! There is not a moving creature, but He hath grasp of its fore-lock. Verily, it is my Lord that is on a straight Path.

If ye turn away,- I (at least) have conveyed the Message with which I was sent to you. My Lord will make another people to succeed you, and you will not harm Him in the least. For my Lord hath care and watch over all things.

name: Prophet Hud (as)
translation: So when Our decree issued, We saved Hud and those who believed with him, by (special) Grace from Ourselves: We saved them from a severe penalty.

name: Disobedience
translation: Such were the 'Ad People: they rejected the Signs of their Lord and Cherisher; disobeyed His messengers; And followed the command of every powerful, obstinate transgressor.

name: Qiyamah
translation: And they were pursued by a Curse in this life,- and on the Day of Judgment. Ah! Behold! for the 'Ad rejected their Lord and Cherisher! Ah! Behold! removed (from sight) were 'Ad the people of Hud!

name: People of Thamud
translation: If they treat thy (mission) as false, so did the peoples before them (with their prophets),- the People of Noah, and 'Ad and Thamud;

name: People of Thamud
translation: As also 'Ad and Thamud, and the Companions of the Rass, and many a generation between them.
The 'Ad (people) rejected the messengers.

name: Taqwa
translation: Behold, their brother Hud said to them: "Will ye not fear (Allah)?
I am to you a messenger worthy of all trust:

name: Taqwa
translation: So fear Allah and obey me.

name: On The Universe
subtopic2: did not ask rewards from people
translation: No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the Lord of the Worlds.

name: Tyranny
translation: Do ye build a landmark on every high place to amuse yourselves?
And do ye get for yourselves fine buildings in the hope of living therein (for ever)?
And when ye exert your strong hand, do ye do it like men of absolute power?

name: Taqwa
translation: Now fear Allah, and obey me.

name: Taqwa
translation: Yea, fear Him Who has bestowed on you freely all that ye know.

name: On Animals
translation: Freely has He bestowed on you cattle and sons,-
And Gardens and Springs.
Truly I fear for you the Penalty of a Great Day.
They said: "It is the same to us whether thou admonish us or be not among (our) admonishers!
This is no other than a customary device of the ancients,
And we are not the ones to receive Pains and Penalties!
So they rejected him, and We destroyed them. Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
And verily thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.

name: People of Thamud
translation: (Remember also) the 'Ad and the Thamud (people): clearly will appear to you from (the traces) of their buildings (their fate): the Evil One made their deeds alluring to them, and kept them back from the Path, though they were gifted with intelligence and skill.

name: Prophet Nuh (as)
translation: Before them (were many who) rejected messengers,- the people of Noah, and 'Ad, and Pharaoh, the Lord of Stakes,

name: Strength
translation: Now the 'Ad behaved arrogantly through the land, against (all) truth and reason, and said: "Who is superior to us in strength?" What! did they not see that Allah, Who created them, was superior to them in strength? But they continued to reject Our Signs!

name: Dunya
translation: So We sent against them a furious Wind through days of disaster, that We might give them a taste of a Penalty of humiliation in this life; but the Penalty of a Hereafter will be more humiliating still: and they will find no help.

name: Prophet Hud (as)
translation: Mention (Hud) one of 'Ad's (own) brethren: Behold, he warned his people about the winding Sand-tracts: but there have been warners before him and after him: "Worship ye none other than Allah: Truly I fear for you the Penalty of a Mighty Day."

name: Truth and Honesty
translation: They said: "Hast thou come in order to turn us aside from our gods? Then bring upon us the (calamity) with which thou dost threaten us, if thou art telling the truth?"

name: Qiyamah
translation: He said: "The Knowledge (of when it will come) is only with Allah: I proclaim to you the mission on which I have been sent: But I see that ye are a people in ignorance!"..

Then, when they saw the (Penalty in the shape of) a cloud traversing the sky, coming to meet their valleys, they said, "This cloud will give us rain!" "Nay, it is the (Calamity) ye were asking to be hastened!- A wind wherein is a Grievous Penalty!
Everything will it destroy by the command of its Lord! Then by the morning they - nothing was to be seen but (the ruins of) their houses! thus do We recompense those given to sin!

subtopic2: not to be treated as a jest or falsehood
translation: And We had firmly established them in a (prosperity and) power which We have not given to you (ye Quraish!) and We had endowed them with (faculties of) hearing, seeing, heart and intellect: but of no profit to them were their (faculties of) hearing, sight, and heart and intellect, when they went on rejecting the Signs of Allah; and they were (completely) encircled by that which they used to mock at!
The 'Ad, Pharaoh, the brethren of Lut,
And in the 'Ad (people) (was another Sign): Behold, We sent against them the devastating Wind:

name: Hajar
translation: The 'Ad (people) (too) rejected (Truth): then how terrible was My Penalty and My Warning?

name: About Difficulties
translation: For We sent against them a furious wind, on a Day of violent Disaster,
Plucking out men as if they were roots of palm-trees torn up (from the ground).
Yea, how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning!

name: People of Thamud
subtopic2: all mankind will stand before the Lord of the Worlds
translation: The Thamud and the 'Ad People (branded) as false the Stunning Calamity!
And the 'Ad, they were destroyed by a furious Wind, exceedingly violent;
Seest thou not how thy Lord dealt with the 'Ad (people),-

name: On Lying
translation: The leaders of the Unbelievers among his people said: "Ah! we see thou art an imbecile!" and "We think thou art a liar!"

name: On The Universe
translation: He said: "O my people! I am no imbecile, but (I am) a messenger from the Lord and Cherisher of the worlds!
I but fulfil towards you the duties of my Lord's mission: I am to you a sincere and trustworthy adviser.

name: Remembrance of Allah (swt)
subtopic2: Remembrance of Allah`s favours and grace _ commanded
translation: Do ye wonder that there hath come to you a message from your Lord through a man of your own people, to warn you? call in remembrance that He made you inheritors after the people of Noah, and gave you a stature tall among the nations. Call in remembrance the benefits (ye have received) from Allah: that so ye may prosper.

name: Truth and Honesty
translation: They said: "Comest thou to us, that we may worship Allah alone, and give up the cult of our fathers? bring us what thou threatenest us with, if so be that thou tellest the truth!"

name: On Anger
translation: He said: "Punishment and wrath have already come upon you from your Lord: dispute ye with me over names which ye have devised - ye and your fathers,- without authority from Allah? then wait: I am amongst you, also waiting."

name: Allah's Mercy
translation: We saved him and those who adhered to him. By Our mercy, and We cut off the roots of those who rejected Our signs and did not believe.

name: Prophet Nuh (as)
translation: And O my people! let not my dissent (from you) cause you to sin, lest ye suffer a fate similar to that of the people of Noah or of Hud or of Salih, nor are the people of Lut far off from you!

name: People of Thamud
subtopic1: Those Prophets that is not said in Torah
translation: Has not the story reached you, (O people!), of those who (went) before you? - of the people of Noah, and 'Ad, and Thamud? - And of those who (came) after them? None knows them but Allah. To them came messengers with Clear (Signs); but they put their hands up to their mouths, and said: "We do deny (the mission) on which ye have been sent, and we are really in suspicious (disquieting) doubt as to that to which ye invite us."

name: People of Thamud
translation: Something like the fate of the People of Noah, the 'Ad, and the Thamud, and those who came after them: but Allah never wishes injustice to his Servants.

name: People of Thamud
translation: But if they turn away, say thou: "I have warned you of a stunning Punishment (as of thunder and lightning) like that which (overtook) the 'Ad and the Thamud!"

name: Angel
translation: Behold, the messengers came to them, from before them and behind them, (preaching): "Serve none but Allah." They said, "If our Lord had so pleased, He would certainly have sent down angels (to preach). Now we reject your mission (altogether)."
It left nothing whatever that it came up against, but reduced it to ruin and rottenness.

He made it rage against them seven nights and eight days in succession: so that thou couldst see the (whole) people lying prostrate in its (path), as they had been roots of hollow palm-trees tumbled down!
Then seest thou any of them left surviving?
Of the (city of) Iram, with lofty pillars,
The like of which were not produced in (all) the land?

name: Shaitan / Satan
translation: And behold, We said to the angels: "Bow down to Adam" and they bowed down. Not so Iblis: he refused and was haughty: He was of those who reject Faith.

name: Shaitan / Satan
subtopic2: gives you shape and makes your shapes beautiful
translation: It is We Who created you and gave you shape; then We bade the angels prostrate to Adam, and they prostrate; not so Iblis; He refused to be of those who prostrate.

name: Angel
translation: So the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together:

name: Prophet Adam (as)
translation: Behold! We said to the angels: "Bow down unto Adam": They bowed down except Iblis: He said, "Shall I bow down to one whom Thou didst create from clay?"

name: Shaitan / Satan
translation: Behold! We said to the angels, "Bow down to Adam": They bowed down except Iblis. He was one of the Jinns, and he broke the Command of his Lord. Will ye then take him and his progeny as protectors rather than Me? And they are enemies to you! Evil would be the exchange for the wrong-doers!

name: Prophet Adam (as)
translation: When We said to the angels, "Prostrate yourselves to Adam", they prostrated themselves, but not Iblis: he refused.

subtopic2: gives you shape and makes your shapes beautiful
translation: When I have fashioned him (in due proportion) and breathed into him of My spirit, fall ye down in obeisance unto him.

name: Angel
translation: So the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together:

name: Ungratefulness
translation: We had already, beforehand, taken the covenant of Adam, but he forgot: and We found on his part no firm resolve.

name: Corruption
translation: Behold, thy Lord said to the angels: "I will create a vicegerent on earth." They said: "Wilt Thou place therein one who will make mischief therein and shed blood?- whilst we do celebrate Thy praises and glorify Thy holy (name)?" He said: "I know what ye know not."

name: Prophet Adam (as)
translation: We created man from sounding clay, from mud moulded into shape;

name: Angel
subtopic2: gives you shape and makes your shapes beautiful
translation: Behold! thy Lord said to the angels: "I am about to create man, from sounding clay from mud moulded into shape;

subtopic2: created things in due proportion and Truth (for just ends)
gives you shape and makes your shapes beautiful
translation: When I have fashioned him (in due proportion) and breathed into him of My spirit, fall ye down in obeisance unto him.
(Iblis) said: "I am not one to prostrate myself to man, whom Thou didst create from sounding clay, from mud moulded into shape."

name: Prophet Adam (as)
translation: Behold, thy Lord said to the angels: "I am about to create man from clay:

name: Shaitan / Satan
translation: Then did Satan make them slip from the (garden), and get them out of the state (of felicity) in which they had been. We said: "Get ye down, all (ye people), with enmity between yourselves. On earth will be your dwelling-place and your means of livelihood - for a time."

name: Qiyamah
translation: So by deceit he brought about their fall: when they tasted of the tree, their shame became manifest to them, and they began to sew together the leaves of the garden over their bodies. And their Lord called unto them: "Did I not forbid you that tree, and tell you that Satan was an avowed enemy unto you?"

name: Nafs
translation: They said: "Our Lord! We have wronged our own souls: If thou forgive us not and bestow not upon us Thy Mercy, we shall certainly be lost."

name: Livelihood
translation: (Allah) said: "Get ye down. With enmity between yourselves. On earth will be your dwelling-place and your means of livelihood,- for a time."
He said: "Therein shall ye live, and therein shall ye die; but from it shall ye be taken out (at last)."

name: Shaitan / Satan
translation: O ye Children of Adam! Let not Satan seduce you, in the same manner as He got your parents out of the Garden, stripping them of their raiment, to expose their shame: for he and his tribe watch you from a position where ye cannot see them: We made the evil ones friends (only) to those without faith.

name: Shaitan / Satan
translation: But Satan whispered evil to him: he said, "O Adam! shall I lead thee to the Tree of Eternity and to a kingdom that never decays?"

name: Disobedience
translation: In the result, they both ate of the tree, and so their nakedness appeared to them: they began to sew together, for their covering, leaves from the Garden: thus did Adam disobey his Lord, and allow himself to be seduced.

name: Prophet Adam (as)
translation: But his Lord chose him (for His Grace): He turned to him, and gave him Guidance.

name: Guidance
translation: He said: "Get ye down, both of you,- all together, from the Garden, with enmity one to another: but if, as is sure, there comes to you Guidance from Me, whosoever follows My Guidance, will not lose his way, nor fall into misery.

name: Prophet Adam (as)
mainTopic1: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation: Then learnt Adam from his Lord words of inspiration, and his Lord Turned towards him; for He is Oft-Returning, Most Merciful.

name: Qiyamah
translation: When thy Lord drew forth from the Children of Adam - from their loins - their descendants, and made them testify concerning themselves, (saying): "Am I not your Lord (who cherishes and sustains you)?"- They said: "Yea! We do testify!" (This), lest ye should say on the Day of Judgment: "Of this we were never mindful":

name: Vanity
translation: Or lest ye should say: "Our fathers before us may have taken false gods, but we are (their) descendants after them: wilt Thou then destroy us because of the deeds of men who were futile?"

name: Truth and Honesty
main_Topic2: all beings in the heavens and earth declare His glory
translation: And He taught Adam the names of all things; then He placed them before the angels, and said: "Tell me the names of these if ye are right."

name: Taqwa
translation: Recite to them the truth of the story of the two sons of Adam. Behold! they each presented a sacrifice (to Allah): It was accepted from one, but not from the other. Said the latter: "Be sure I will slay thee." "Surely," said the former, "Allah doth accept of the sacrifice of those who are righteous.

name: Cain and Abel
translation: If thou dost stretch thy hand against me, to slay me, it is not for me to stretch my hand against thee to slay thee: for I do fear Allah, the cherisher of the worlds.

name: Cain and Abel
translation: For me, I intend to let thee draw on thyself my sin as well as thine, for thou wilt be among the companions of the fire, and that is the reward of those who do wrong.

name: Nafs
translation: The (selfish) soul of the other led him to the murder of his brother: he murdered him, and became (himself) one of the lost ones.

name: Cain and Abel
translation: Then Allah sent a raven, who scratched the ground, to show him how to hide the shame of his brother. "Woe is me!" said he; "Was I not even able to be as this raven, and to hide the shame of my brother?" then he became full of regrets-
Therefore give admonition in case the admonition profits (the hearer).

name: Jahannam / Hell
translation: The admonition will be received by those who fear (Allah):
But it will be avoided by those most unfortunate ones,
Who will enter the Great Fire,

subtopic2: inmates will neither die nor remain alive
translation: In which they will then neither die nor live.

name: Dawah
subtopic2: is not responsible for arranging your affairs
translation: Therefore do thou give admonition, for thou art one to admonish.

subtopic2: is not responsible for arranging your affairs
translation: Thou art not one to manage (men's) affairs.

name: About Disbelievers
translation: But if any turn away and reject Allah,-
Allah will punish him with a mighty Punishment,

main_Topic2: all beings in the heavens and earth declare His glory
translation: For to Us will be their return;

main_Topic2: all beings in the heavens and earth declare His glory
translation: Then it will be for Us to call them to account.

name: Inheritance
translation: Allah has not made for any man two hearts in his (one) body: nor has He made your wives whom ye divorce by Zihar your mothers: nor has He made your adopted sons your sons. Such is (only) your (manner of) speech by your mouths. But Allah tells (you) the Truth, and He shows the (right) Way.

name: Intention
translation: Call them by (the names of) their fathers: that is juster in the sight of Allah. But if ye know not their father's (names, call them) your Brothers in faith, or your maulas. But there is no blame on you if ye make a mistake therein: (what counts is) the intention of your hearts: and Allah is Oft-Returning, Most Merciful.

name: Taqwa
translation: Behold! Thou didst say to one who had received the grace of Allah and thy favour: "Retain thou (in wedlock) thy wife, and fear Allah." But thou didst hide in thy heart that which Allah was about to make manifest: thou didst fear the people, but it is more fitting that thou shouldst fear Allah. Then when Zaid had dissolved (his marriage) with her, with the necessary (formality), We joined her in marriage to thee: in order that (in future) there may be no difficulty to the Believers in (the matter of) marriage with the wives of their adopted sons, when the latter have dissolved with the necessary (formality) (their marriage) with them. And Allah's command must be fulfilled.

name: Taqwa
subtopic1: Justice – Equity – Fairness – Judge With Justice – Equitably
subtopic2: not burdened beyond capability to withstand
Allah does not burden a soul more than it can bear
translation: On no soul doth Allah Place a burden greater than it can bear. It gets every good that it earns, and it suffers every ill that it earns. (Pray:) "Our Lord! Condemn us not if we forget or fall into error; our Lord! Lay not on us a burden Like that which Thou didst lay on those before us; Our Lord! Lay not on us a burden greater than we have strength to bear. Blot out our sins, and grant us forgiveness. Have mercy on us. Thou art our Protector; Help us against those who stand against faith."

name: Taqwa
subtopic2: not burdened beyond capability to withstand
Allah does not burden a soul more than it can bear
translation: And come not nigh to the orphan's property, except to improve it, until he attain the age of full strength; give measure and weight with (full) justice;- no burden do We place on any soul, but that which it can bear;- whenever ye speak, speak justly, even if a near relative is concerned; and fulfil the covenant of Allah: thus doth He command you, that ye may remember.

name: Nafs
subtopic2: not burdened beyond capability to withstand
Allah does not burden a soul more than it can bear
translation: But those who believe and work righteousness,- no burden do We place on any soul, but that which it can bear,- they will be Companions of the Garden, therein to dwell (for ever).

name: Nafs
main_Topic2: Allah does not burden a soul more than it can bear
subtopic2: not burdened beyond capability to withstand
Allah does not burden a soul more than it can bear
no one can bear the burdens of another
translation: On no soul do We place a burden greater than it can bear: before Us is a record which clearly shows the truth: they will never be wronged.

name: Nafs
main_Topic2: Allah does not burden a soul more than it can bear
subtopic2: to Him is the final goal
to Himyou shall be brought (gathered) back
Allah does not burden a soul more than it can bear
no one can bear the burdens of another
translation: Say: "Shall I seek for (my) Cherisher other than Allah, when He is the Cherisher of all things (that exist)? Every soul draws the meed of its acts on none but itself: no bearer of burdens can bear the burden of another. Your goal in the end is towards Allah: He will tell you the truth of the things wherein ye disputed."

name: Nafs
subtopic2: Allah does not burden a soul more than it can bear
no one can bear the burdens of another
bringers of glad tidings and warners
translation: Who receiveth guidance, receiveth it for his own benefit: who goeth astray doth so to his own loss: No bearer of burdens can bear the burden of another: nor would We visit with Our Wrath until We had sent an messenger (to give warning).

name: Nafs
subtopic2: to Him is the final goal
Allah does not burden a soul more than it can bear
no one can bear the burdens of another
translation: Nor can a bearer of burdens bear another's burdens if one heavily laden should call another to (bear) his load. Not the least portion of it can be carried (by the other). Even though he be nearly related. Thou canst but admonish such as fear their Lord unseen and establish regular Prayer. And whoever purifies himself does so for the benefit of his own soul; and the destination (of all) is to Allah.

name: Respecting Other Religions
subtopic2: Allah does not burden a soul more than it can bear
no one can bear the burdens of another
translation: If ye reject (Allah), Truly Allah hath no need of you; but He liketh not ingratitude from His servants: if ye are grateful, He is pleased with you. No bearer of burdens can bear the burden of another. In the end, to your Lord is your Return, when He will tell you the truth of all that ye did (in this life). for He knoweth well all that is in (men's) hearts.

name: Ungratefulness
translation: O ye who believe! seek help with patient perseverance and prayer; for Allah is with those who patiently persevere.

name: Livelihood
translation: Be sure we shall test you with something of fear and hunger, some loss in goods or lives or the fruits (of your toil), but give glad tidings to those who patiently persevere,

name: Zakat
subtopic2: all mankind will stand before the Lord of the Worlds
is the act of a truly pious person
translation: It is not righteousness that ye turn your faces Towards east or West; but it is righteousness- to believe in Allah and the Last Day, and the Angels, and the Book, and the Messengers; to spend of your substance, out of love for Him, for your kin, for orphans, for the needy, for the wayfarer, for those who ask, and for the ransom of slaves; to be steadfast in prayer, and practice regular charity; to fulfil the contracts which ye have made; and to be firm and patient, in pain (or suffering) and adversity, and throughout all periods of panic. Such are the people of truth, the Allah-fearing.

name: Patience
translation: When they advanced to meet Goliath and his forces, they prayed: "Our Lord! Pour out constancy on us and make our steps firm: Help us against those that reject faith."

name: Truth and Honesty
translation: Those who show patience, Firmness and self-control; who are true (in word and deed); who worship devoutly; who spend (in the way of Allah); and who pray for forgiveness in the early hours of the morning.

name: Taqwa
translation: Yea, - if ye remain firm, and act aright, even if the enemy should rush here on you in hot haste, your Lord would help you with five thousand angels Making a terrific onslaught.

name: Patience
translation: Did ye think that ye would enter Heaven without Allah testing those of you who fought hard (In His Cause) and remained steadfast?

name: Strength
translation: How many of the prophets fought (in Allah's way), and with them (fought) Large bands of godly men? but they never lost heart if they met with disaster in Allah's way, nor did they weaken (in will) nor give in. And Allah Loves those who are firm and steadfast.

name: Taqwa
translation: Ye shall certainly be tried and tested in your possessions and in your personal selves; and ye shall certainly Hear much that will grieve you, from those who received the Book before you and from those who worship many gods. But if ye persevere patiently, and guard against evil,-then that will be a determining factor in all affairs.

name: Taqwa
translation: O ye who believe! Persevere in patience and constancy; vie in such perseverance; strengthen each other; and fear Allah; that ye may prosper.

name: Patience
translation: And if there is a party among you who believes in the message with which I have been sent, and a party which does not believe, hold yourselves in patience until Allah doth decide between us: for He is the best to decide.

name: Revenge
translation: But thou dost wreak thy vengeance on us simply because we believed in the Signs of our Lord when they reached us! Our Lord! pour out on us patience and constancy, and take our souls unto thee as Muslims (who bow to thy will)!

name: Taqwa
subtopic2: all that is on it will perish
translation: Said Moses to his people: "Pray for help from Allah, and (wait) in patience and constancy: for the earth is Allah's, to give as a heritage to such of His servants as He pleaseth; and the end is (best) for the righteous.

name: Inheritance
translation: And We made a people, considered weak (and of no account), inheritors of lands in both east and west, - lands whereon We sent down Our blessings. The fair promise of thy Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel, because they had patience and constancy, and We levelled to the ground the great works and fine buildings which Pharaoh and his people erected (with such pride).

name: Disobedience
translation: And obey Allah and His Messenger; and fall into no disputes, lest ye lose heart and your power depart; and be patient and persevering: For Allah is with those who patiently persevere:

name: Patience
translation: O Prophet! rouse the Believers to the fight. If there are twenty amongst you, patient and persevering, they will vanquish two hundred: if a hundred, they will vanquish a thousand of the Unbelievers: for these are a people without understanding.

name: Patience
translation: For the present, Allah hath lightened your (task), for He knoweth that there is a weak spot in you: But (even so), if there are a hundred of you, patient and persevering, they will vanquish two hundred, and if a thousand, they will vanquish two thousand, with the leave of Allah: for Allah is with those who patiently persevere.

name: Qur'an Verses on the Qur'an
translation: Follow thou the inspiration sent unto thee, and be patient and constant, till Allah do decide: for He is the best to decide.

name: Forgiveness
translation: Not so do those who show patience and constancy, and work righteousness; for them is forgiveness (of sins) and a great reward.

name: Taqwa
translation: Such are some of the stories of the unseen, which We have revealed unto thee: before this, neither thou nor thy people knew them. So persevere patiently: for the End is for those who are righteous.

name: Taqwa
translation: And be steadfast in patience; for verily Allah will not suffer the reward of the righteous to perish.

name: Nafs
translation: They stained his shirt with false blood. He said: "Nay, but your minds have made up a tale (that may pass) with you, (for me) patience is most fitting: Against that which ye assert, it is Allah (alone) Whose help can be sought"..

name: Nafs
translation: Jacob said: "Nay, but ye have yourselves contrived a story (good enough) for you. So patience is most fitting (for me). Maybe Allah will bring them (back) all to me (in the end). For He is indeed full of knowledge and wisdom."

name: Taqwa
subtopic2: will not suffer the reward to be lost
translation: They said: "Art thou indeed Joseph?" He said, "I am Joseph, and this is my brother: Allah has indeed been gracious to us (all): behold, he that is righteous and patient,- never will Allah suffer the reward to be lost, of those who do right."

name: Taqwa
translation: Those who patiently persevere, seeking the countenance of their Lord; Establish regular prayers; spend, out of (the gifts) We have bestowed for their sustenance, secretly and openly; and turn off Evil with good: for such there is the final attainment of the (eternal) home,-

name: Karma
subtopic2: what is with Him will endure
translation: What is with you must vanish: what is with Allah will endure. And We will certainly bestow, on those who patiently persevere, their reward according to the best of their actions.

name: Trials of Life
translation: But verily thy Lord,- to those who leave their homes after trials and persecutions,- and who thereafter strive and fight for the faith and patiently persevere,- Thy Lord, after all this is oft-forgiving, Most Merciful.

name: Revenge
translation: And if ye do catch them out, catch them out no worse than they catch you out: But if ye show patience, that is indeed the best (course) for those who are patient.

name: Prophet Idris (as)
translation: And (remember) Isma'il, Idris, and Zul-kifl, all (men) of constancy and patience;

name: Zakat
translation: To those whose hearts when Allah is mentioned, are filled with fear, who show patient perseverance over their afflictions, keep up regular prayer, and spend (in charity) out of what We have bestowed upon them.

name: Patience
translation: I have rewarded them this Day for their patience and constancy: they are indeed the ones that have achieved Bliss...

name: Rizq
translation: Twice will they be given their reward, for that they have persevered, that they avert Evil with Good, and that they spend (in charity) out of what We have given them.

name: Tawakkul
translation: Those who persevere in patience, and put their trust, in their Lord and Cherisher.

name: Patience
translation: So patiently persevere: for verily the promise of Allah is true: nor let those shake thy firmness, who have (themselves) no certainty of faith.

name: Youth
translation: O my son! establish regular prayer, enjoin what is just, and forbid what is wrong: and bear with patient constancy whatever betide thee; for this is firmness (of purpose) in (the conduct of) affairs.

name: Atheism
translation: Seest thou not that the ships sail through the ocean by the Grace of Allah?- that He may show you of His Signs? Verily in this are Signs for all who constantly persevere and give thanks.

name: Swearing
translation: And take in thy hand a little grass, and strike therewith: and break not (thy oath). Truly We found him full of patience and constancy. How excellent in Our service! ever did he turn (to Us)!

name: Taqwa
subtopic2: all that is on it will perish
translation: Say: "O ye my servants who believe! Fear your Lord, good is (the reward) for those who do good in this world. Spacious is Allah's earth! those who patiently persevere will truly receive a reward without measure!"

name: Forgiveness
translation: Patiently, then, persevere: for the Promise of Allah is true: and ask forgiveness for thy fault, and celebrate the Praises of thy Lord in the evening and in the morning.

name: Patience
translation: So persevere in patience; for the Promise of Allah is true: and whether We show thee (in this life) some part of what We promise them,- or We take thy soul (to Our Mercy) (before that),-(in any case) it is to Us that they shall (all) return.

name: Youth
translation: And no one will be granted such goodness except those who exercise patience and self-restraint,- none but persons of the greatest good fortune.

name: Patience
translation: If it be His Will He can still the Wind: then would they become motionless on the back of the (ocean). Verily in this are Signs for everyone who patiently perseveres and is grateful.

name: Qiyamah
subtopic2: do not ask for speedy doom for apostates
translation: Therefore patiently persevere, as did (all) messengers of inflexible purpose; and be in no haste about the (Unbelievers). On the Day that they see the (Punishment) promised them, (it will be) as if they had not tarried more than an hour in a single day. (Thine but) to proclaim the Message: but shall any be destroyed except those who transgress?

name: Trials of Life
translation: And We shall try you until We test those among you who strive their utmost and persevere in patience; and We shall try your reported (mettle).

name: Patience
